_comment: Created by rreed on 25/05/2017 13:34:18 using v2.7
title: How have the numbers of health visitors changed?
analysis_commentary:
Health visitors support and educate families from pregnancy through to a child's fifth birthday. Common tasks include: offering parenting support and advice on family health, new birth visits (which include advice on feeding, weaning and dental health) and physical and developmental checks providing families with specific support on subjects such as postnatal depression.

In October 2010, the Government made a commitment to increase the numbers of health visitors by 4,200 by 2015 but this target was missed. The number of health visitors (FTE) decreased from 8,100 in September 2009 to a low of 7,375 in August 2012 and increased to a peak of 10,309 in October 2015. As of January 2017 there were 9,259 health visitors (FTE).

Updated April 2017.
